modules.description: This module handles arithmetic and comparison operations on time intervals, including addition, subtraction, and unit conversions across nanoseconds, microseconds, milliseconds, and larger durations. It works with span types derived from 64-bit integers and floats, ensuring precision during conversions and validating input ranges. Use cases include precise time measurement in performance tracking or scheduling, alongside formatted output for human-readable time spans using SI prefixes.

Provides functions to retrieve and manipulate nanosecond-precision timestamps and time spans from a monotonic clock. Works with types representing durations and absolute time points, supporting operations like duration addition and timestamp subtraction. Used to measure elapsed time in applications requiring high precision and stability against system time changes.

handles arithmetic, comparison, and unit conversion for time spans, using 64-bit integers and floats to ensure precision. it supports operations like adding or subtracting durations and formatting spans with SI prefixes. it enables accurate performance tracking and scheduling by manipulating non-negative time intervals. examples include calculating elapsed time between events or converting nanoseconds to seconds for display.

Provides functions to measure elapsed monotonic time in spans or nanoseconds, retrieve system-relative timestamps, and create counters for tracking time intervals. Operates with `Mtime.span`, `int64`, and `counter` types to ensure precise time tracking. Used for synchronizing events across processes or measuring performance without interference from system time changes.
